channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Cops confirm two sets of human remains were found at Lori Vallow's husband's home
item.description: Rexburg Police confirmed on Wednesday that two sets of remains were discovered on Chad Daybell's property in Salem, Idaho, during a search for the missing kids the day before.

item.title: JK Rowling reveals she was sexually assaulted in her 20s as she hits back in 'transphobia' rowÂ
item.description: The Harry Potter author appeared to confirm for the first time that she had suffered domestic abuse, describing her first marriage to Portuguese journalism student Jorge Arantas as 'violent'.

item.title: PM frees millions of couples to visit their partners and allows lone grandparents to see families
item.description: From Saturday two households can form 'support bubbles' that can meet indoors and stay overnight. But one of the two must be either a single person living alone or a single parent with children.

item.title: Has the tomb of Cleopatra FINALLY been found?
item.description: Archaeologists leading a dig in Egypt believe Cleopatra is buried at a temple called Taposiris Magna, just outside of Alexandria, alongside Roman lover and general Mark Anthony.

item.title: Museum curator tweets advice on destroying bronze statues
item.description: Madeline Odent, curator of Royston Museum in Hertfordshire, sent the series of tweets last night to her 5,164 followers, which were then shared thousands of times and provoked outrage.

item.title: Hertfordshire police arrive at home of museum curator who tweeted how to destroy bronze statues
item.description: Police arrived at the home of Madeline Odent in Hertfordshire today, but got no answer after knocking at her door. Statues have been targeted during Black Lives Matter protests.

item.title: Ant and Dec issue apology for 'impersonating people of colour' on Saturday Night Takeaway
item.description: Ant and Dec have issued an apology to their Twitter followers for 'impersonating people of colour' during 'comedy' sketches on Saturday Night Takeaway.

item.title: Liverpool mayor refuses to change name of Penny Lane after claims it is linked to slaverÂ
item.description: Liverpool Mayor Joe Anderson said there is 'no evidence' to support the claim that Penny Lane - made famous by The Beatles' song of the same name - is linked to slave ship owner James Penny.

item.title: Boyfriend heard his girlfriend's harrowing screams as she was killed in horrific car crash
item.description: Chloe Lloyd was driving home with her daughter and speaking to her partner via hands-free mobile when her Vauxhall Astra left the A35 near Poole, Dorset and crashed into a tree.

item.title: 78 statues and monuments at risk of being torn down by 'Topple The Racists' campaign
item.description: A website called 'Topple The Racists' has identified dozens of landmarks of colonialists, politicians and kings that they say need to be removed 'so that Britain can finally face the truth about its past'.

item.title: Boris Johnson accused of 'flailing' over schools reopening
item.description: At the Downing Street briefing this evening, Boris Johnson conceded that the government was having to move slower than hoped because coronavirus infections were still too high.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals what it's like to be in a sexless relationship
item.description: Tracey Cox spoke to people in sexless relationships to find out what it's like - inlcuding one British woman, 29, who's devastated, while another wife, 39, says she's perfectly happy.

item.title: Now 130 Labour councils draw up hit-list of statues with colonial ties
item.description: Sir Thomas Guy helped set up the hospital near London Bridge in 1721 having made his fortune as a major shareholder of a company selling slaves to the Spanish Colonies.

item.title: How many more will be axed?
item.description: The controversial character was played by actorÂ Reece Shearsmith in the comedy series, and has been heavily criticised over the years for his painted black face.

item.title: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle and Archie 'spoke to Prince Philip to wish him a happy 99th birthday'
item.description: Royal expert Carolyn Durand took to Twitter to claim Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will speak to Prince Philip on his 99th birthday - but unlike other royals they opted against posting a public tribute.

item.title: Coronavirus 'could be up to four times LESS deadly than feared'
item.description: An expert at Stanford University in California suggested the true death rate of the coronavirus is around 0.25 per cent, meaning the UK's 51,000 deaths suggest 20million have had the virus.

item.title: Netflix subscribers claim hit film The Help has a 'white saviour' narrative
item.description: Social media users from across the world have blasted Netflix US for streaming historical drama The Help amid ongoing protests. Many argue the 2011 film has a 'white saviour' narrative.

item.title: Dozens of migrants arrive in Dover after they were picked up in three small boats
item.description: The group, who were picked up by a French patrol boat at 6.35am after attempting to cross the Channel in a make-shift vessel, had used shovels as oars.

item.title: Madeleine suspect is at centre of a legal row over blunders that freed him from jail two years ago
item.description: The revelations come as Brueckner, 43, is at the centre of a major row in Germany over whether he should be freed as it emerged he was released from prison in 2018 and allowed to travel.

item.title: Bone bird carving found at tip may be 'China's oldest work of art'
item.description: A tiny 13,300-year-old bone carving of bird unearthed at a rubbish tip has been hailed as 'China's oldest work of art' by an international team of scientists.

item.title: Revealed, the best way to find out your blood type
item.description: A study by the genetic testing website 23AndMe suggested that people with O-type blood appear to be more likely to get diagnosed with the coronavirus, so here's how to find out your blood type.

item.title: Two sisters found dead at London beauty spot were stabbed 'multiple times'
item.description: Nicole Smallman (pictured), 27, and Bibaa Henry, 46, were found in Fryent Country Park in Wembley on Sunday. A post-mortem gave the cause of death for both women as stab wounds.

item.title: Police have ruled out Christian Brueckner as suspect in rape of Irish holiday rep
item.description: Friedrich FÃ¼lscher,Â who representsÂ Christian Brueckner told German media: 'How can a person, who is isolated in a prison and whom half the world's population accuses of the worst crimes, be?'

item.title: Patient, 34, dies after judge ruled he had right to refuse permanent stoma bagÂ
item.description: Mr Justice Hayden ruled earlier this month that the man, who was in intensive care at Barnsley hospital, could be allowed to die after considering evidence at a virtual hearing in the Court of Protection.

item.title: Anthony Joshua and Tyson Fury reach a 'financial agreement' for TWO world-title fights
item.description: Discussions over a mouthwatering Battle of Britain, which would see all four major world heavyweight titles on the line, has been ongoing for months.

item.title: Coral islands like the Maldives could survive sea level rise
item.description: An international team of scientists, led by the University of Plymouth, found coral reef islands, such as the Maldives, could naturally adapt to survive surging water levels.

item.title: McDonald's reopens 571 branches for delivery TODAY
item.description: McDonald's opened 571 locations across the UK and Ireland for delivery today, while outlining plans for takeaway and click and collect services to resume in some branches.

item.title: Coronavirus: Air travel has been a 'major' driver in spread
item.description: A report by the Institute for Economics and Peace said that international flights - on which the UK never placed a ban - had 'facilitated contagion' of the coronavirus around the world.

item.title: Eight years' jail for socialite who sent indecent photos of child
item.description: Katie Weeks, 36, lived a glamorous lifestyle close to the millionaire's enclave in Poole, Dorset, and was married to the director of a successful interior design agency. She has been jailed for nine years.

item.title: Opposition to Baroness Scotland Commonwealth reappointment
item.description: A leaked letter from Boris Johnson to other leaders said a call for Baroness Scotland (pictured) to be granted a second term as secretary general amid the coronavirus crisis had been turned down.

item.title: Town centres are recovering from the lockdown faster than big cities, research reveals
item.description: Data recorded by Centre for Cities shows footfall is much higher in UK towns compared to cities, with activity levels in Aldershot, Hampshire at 57 per cent of pre-lockdown numbers.

item.title: NHS nurse, 62, dies of coronavirus after sitting with surgery patient who later tested positive
item.description: Dominga David worked at University Hospital Llandough when she was infected. She was sent home on March 31 and died on May 26, South Wales Central coroner's court in Pontypridd heard.

item.title: Have you been microwaving your popcorn wrong?
item.description: If you place a bag of popcorn into the microwave before 'preheating' the microwave itself then you're not getting the best results from your corn kernels.

item.title: Coronavirus: US study says tests miss a fifth of infections
item.description: A new study from Johns Hopkins Medicine found that if coronavirus tests were administered four days after a person became infected, the false-negative rate was about 67%.

item.title: Incredible story of the 'true hero of the Titanic' who saved dozens of women and children
item.description: Harold Lowe was a hero of the Titanic and some of his treasured belongings are now going on sale for Â£60,000. His whistle, ceremonial hat and certificate of competency are among the items.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 41,000 with 245 new fatalities
item.description: Department of Health figures show the official number of victims has now topped 41,000 but other grim statistics yesterday revealed the actual number of deaths is closer to the 52,000-mark.

item.title: Bulldog takes the stairs - but is he going upstairs or down?
item.description: Groot lives in Hadley, New Jersey with owner Gina Creuz. The video is an optical illusion and has caused confusion as to which direction he is traveling on the stairs.

item.title: Boy skates at 15mph propelled by garden leaf blower
item.description: The young boy is shown hurtling down an empty road, believed to be in the US. He also uses the blower to give him more power to skate backwards.

item.title: Anti-racism campaigners call for 'The 'Black Boy' pubs across Britain to be renamed
item.description: Calls are being made for pubs in Britain called 'The Black Boy' to be renamed amid growing anti-racism protests by the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Pedestrian killed by hit-and-run driver during police chase in horror smash in Wakefield
item.description: The motorist crashed into pedestrian Andrew Kitson, 44, (pictured) while he was chased by police through Wakefield in West Yorkshire yesterday afternoon.

item.title: Kensington Palace gardener reveals 75 per cent of his team has been furloughed
item.description: Kensington Palace's head gardener has revealed his fighting spirit, as he leads a scaled-back team to keep the Palace's famous gardens in order amid the pandemic.

item.title: Famous London casino The Ritz Club will not reopen after lockdown leaving members 'devastated'Â
item.description: The famous Mayfair gambling establishment had temporarily suspended casino operations on March 19, just before the UK entered lockdown and was sold days later.

item.title: Leaked emails suggest Elon Musk is ready to ramp up production of Tesla's all-electric Semi trucks
item.description: In an email seen by Reuters, Tesla CEO Elon Musk did not specify a timeframe for ramping up production of its electric Semi, but said that production will begin in Nevada.

item.title: Study shows 70 per cent of people are more likely to listen to expert advice after COVID
item.description: The survey - commissioned by UK-based communications agencyÂ Higginson Strategy - also found that women are more likely to heed expert guidance.

item.title: Touching moment father surprises his hazmat suit-wearing children
item.description: Ben Shard, 36, visited his three children at the home where they live with his former partner, Claire Sharman, 31, in Sarnau, Wales, and enjoyed a tearful reunion in the front garden.

item.title: Spooky images show abandoned industrial places in desolate locations throughout the world
item.description: The images feature in new book Abandoned Industrial Places, which has more than 200 images of factories, laboratories, mills and mines from all four corners of the globe left to ruin.

item.title: Astronomers observe 'Jekyll and Hyde' behavior in a double star system 19,000 light-years away
item.description: Located in the cluster called Terzan 5, which is 19,000 light-years away, experts spotted a system that uses both X-rays and radio waves, and they switch between alter egos every few years.

item.title: 6ft 7in woman signed by modelling agency recalls bullying
item.description: NaomiÂ Lovell,Â 22, from Doncaster, Yorkshire, says she receives unwanted sexual attention on social media because of her striking stature but now feels more confident after signing to Ugly Models.

item.title: Calculating the speed of solar eruptions could help protect astronauts and satellites
item.description: Currently forecasters focus on the size of coronal mass ejections coming from the Sun, rather than their speed, when warning of any possible impact they might have.

item.title: Dramatic moment silo collapses at nuclear power plant Hinkley Point C
item.description: French energy supplier EDF, which will launch an investigation into the incident, has denied that there was an explosion at the nuclear plant near Bridgwater, Somerset.

item.title: Riots could break out in UK this summer, SAGE adviser warns
item.description: Professor Clifford Stott - a member of Number 10's SAGE panel - saidÂ urgent efforts are needed by police forces to quell any potential unrest in the neighbourhoods they serve.

item.title: Revealed! People who REALLY aren't handling lockdown well
item.description: A series of photos taken by people from across the globe, which have been collated online by GoSocial, prove that not everyone is handling lockdown well.

item.title: Secondary schools reopen in Spain, Netherlands and South Africa
item.description: Switzerland and the Netherlands have achieved what Britain hoped to do, sending all primary-age pupils back - saying that the risk of young children spreading the disease is low.

item.title: Couple transform dilapidated church bought for Â£85K into stunning contemporary home
item.description: Hannah Lewis, 29, an occupational therapist from West Cumbria, and her partner Wayne purchased the old church in 2015 at a cost of Â£85,000 and began renovating it in 2016.

item.title: Met Office issues severe weather warning for flooding
item.description: Forecasters warn up to 70mm (2.75 ins) of rain could fall in six hours later today, with motorists urged to take care on the roads across Cornwall, Devon, Plymouth and Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus: EU accuses China and Russia of misinformation push
item.description: A 17-page EU report into Chinese and Russian coronavirus misinformation campaigns says Beijing and Moscow had set out to polarise debate and burnish their own images.

item.title: Police hunt woman after EIGHT bottles of gin were stolen from Marks and Spencer
item.description: Police are on the hunt for a woman after eight bottles of gin were stolen from an M&S store. CCTV images of a blonde woman have been released after the theft in St George's Street, Whitefriars, Canterbury.

item.title: How COULD schools go back? Calls for 'furlough-style' plan to get children back in the classroomÂ
item.description: Boris Johnson is under pressure after plans for all primary school children to return for a month of school before the summer break in July were abandoned yesterday, with no clear way forward.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Defunding the police is a bats**** crazy idea that will help Trump get re-electedÂ
item.description: In the past two weeks, we've seen the very worst of police work in America, and some of the very best. The worst manifested itself with the slow, contemptuous murder of George Floyd.

item.title: Fantastic Beasts star Eddie Redmayne hits out at J.K. Rowling
item.description: Eddie Redmayne has become the latest star to hit out at JK Rowling over her comments surrounding transgender people.

item.title: HBO Max temporarily pulls Gone With The Wind after accusations it 'glorifies the antebellum south'Â
item.description: Gone With The Wind has been removed temporarily by HBO Max from its streaming service in the light of widespread unease at America's racial legacy. The film will return 'with historical context'.

item.title: Russian lion cub had legs broken 'so it could not escape while tourists posed for photos with it'
item.description: Vladimir Putin was so shocked that he personally ordered a criminal probe into the cruelty Simba the lion experienced, who was just a few weeks old when snatched from his mother.

item.title: Queen and Prince Philip photograph marks Duke's 99th birthday
item.description: The Queen, 94, and Prince Philip were poignantly photographed side-by-side at Windsor Castle to mark The Duke's 99th birthday on Wednesday.

item.title: Porn stars turn up unannounced in hilarious online safety campaignÂ
item.description: The clip is part of the New Zealand government's efforts to get parents to talk to their children about real-life relationships and the importance of consent with a sexual partner.

item.title: Plucky buyer who wrote to owners of a house she liked reveals how she got it
item.description: Social worker Sally Deakin, 35, from Doncaster, spotted the five-bed terrace on Lawn Avenue in 2017 and decided to ask the owners - via a letter through the door - if they'd sell.

item.title: Police launch urgent search for two missing sisters, aged 11 and 9
item.description: Matilda Hooligan, 11, and her nine-year-old sister Scarlett, were last seen at their home in Southport, Merseyside, on May 31. They are believed to be with a member of their family.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Tory fury at Boris Johnson over 2-metre rule
item.description: Boris Johnson is coming under growing pressure to relax the two-metre instruction, which is hampering the return of schools and crippling swathes of the economy.

item.title: A fifth of the UK's partially deaf who have NHS hearing aids do not bother to wear them
item.description: Researchers from the University of Manchester interviewedÂ 16,000 people with some degree of hearing loss about their use of NHS funded equipment.

item.title: Spain flights to be more expensive with coronavirus safety plans
item.description: The announcement has sparked concerns of higher air fares and the potential collapse of embattled airlines.

item.title: Widow's late husband was diagnosed with a brain tumour six WEEKS after their first date
item.description: Speaking on This Morning, Sara Challice, 49 from London, revealed how she became ill while caring for Neal, because she wasn't looking after herself and became isolated from family and friends.

item.title: Kids do the funniest things! Parents share their children hilarious attempts to be logical
item.description: Social media users from around the world have been sharing their children's most ridiculous and illogical acts in a hilarious online gallery collated by BoredPanda.

item.title: Three new Planet Earth-observation spacecraft to hitch a lift with SpaceX
item.description: The observation satellites are operated by Planet, who say the three new spacecraft being launched on the Falcon rocket will bring their constellation up to 18.

item.title: Texas inmate, 60, who spent 40 years on death row for murder is granted parole
item.description: Long-time death row inmate Bobby Moore was granted parole on Monday, months after being re-sentencedÂ to life in prison for the 1980 murder of a 72-year-old supermarket clerk during a robbery.

item.title: Boris Johnson hints contact tracing figures might FINALLY be released tomorrow
item.description: The much delayed operation was rolled out at the start of June along with a 25,000-strong army of staff but ministers have so far refused to release data on how well it is working.

item.title: Aldi is first UK supermarket to stock coronavirus face masks
item.description: Aldi is selling reusable face masks for Â£4.99. They are available in one size, are double layered, ideal for covering both mouth and nose, and are made from machine-washable cotton.

item.title: NATO drills get underway in the Baltic Sea
item.description: NATO's annual training exercise in the Baltic Sea is now underway, with 28 ships and aircraft on manoeuvers for 10 days alongside 3,000 troops from 19 countries including the UK, US and Germany.

item.title: Creepy facial-recognition search engine tracks down a person's photos online
item.description: A Polish website called PimEyes uses facial recognition to search the internet for pictures of a person based on a single image.

item.title: F35B Lightning jets from historic squadron land on Â£3bn aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth
item.description: F-35 Lightning Jets from historic 'Dambusters' squadron have landed on HMS Queen Elizabeth for the first time as the jets completed a series of time trials on the aircraft carrier near Portsmouth.

item.title: One Show presenter Amol Rajan wins huge praise over his report on Little Britain and racism
item.description: Viewers said the Media Editor's monologue left them 'in awe' after he updated news anchor Huw Edwards on the news that Little Britain had been removed from Netflix, BBC iPlayer and BritBox.

item.title: Stolen Banksy tribute to Paris terror victims found in farmhouse
item.description: The artwork, which depicted a sorrowful girl in mourning painted on emergency doors of the famous Bataclan concert hall in Paris, was cut out and snatched in January 2019.

item.title: Violence fears as far-Right thugs share plans to 'defend' statues
item.description: Police fear far-Right thugs could descend on the capital this weekend to take on anti-racism protesters. Football hooligans are planning counter-protests to 'defend' memorials.

item.title: London's oldest Elizabethan playhouse known as 'the Red Lion' is unearthed
item.description: Archaeologists believe they have discovered the location of the Red Lion in Whitechapel, east London. It was built around 1567 and was a prototype for the theatre that staged Shakespeare's first plays.

item.title: Inside the Indian tribe once feared for decapitating their rivals and displaying severed body parts
item.description: A series of striking photographs reveals the distinctive facial features of the frail Konyak people, sporting nose plugs, brandishing spears, and wearing jewellery crafted from dead animals.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry 'shifting focus' to support BLM
item.description: The Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 38, are 'shifting their focus' and will be 'doing a lot more work' to support Black Lives Matter, royal expert Katie Nicholl told Entertainment Tonight.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'believes school closures as damaging as credit crunch'Â
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is believed to be among the most hawkish in government on the need to reopen schools.

item.title: Police find body of woman, 19, near footpath at popular beauty spot in Bury
item.description: Police were called to reports of concern for welfare near the Kirklees Trail, a former railway line linking Greenmount to Bury, at around 1.10am today.

item.title: Coronavirus infections in Denmark are FALLING are lockdown eased and restaurants and shops reopened
item.description: The country of 5.8million people was theÂ first outside of Asia to roll back strict lockdown measures last month - and there is no evidence so far of a second spike in infections.

item.title: Boozy blowouts to Mary Berry...here are 99 things you need to learn about birthday boy Prince Philip
item.description: With coronavirus pandemic ruining plans for a family party, Prince Philip will celebrate his 99th birthday today with a modest lunch with the Queen at Windsor where they have been isolating.

item.title: Top Asian police officer says 'taking the knee is a powerful symbol of hope'
item.description: Metropolitan Police Assistant Commissioner Neil Basu claimed the country is riddled with 'racial bias' which is 'built into the very fabric of our institutions and society'.

item.title: Swedish police say they've SOLVED the 1986 murder of PM Olof Palme
item.description: Stig EngstrÃ¶m, a designer known as 'Skandia Man' after the company where he worked, has been named by police as the man they believe killed Swedish Prime Minister Olof Palme in 1986.

item.title: The Queen wears heart-shaped diamond brooch in Prince Philip's birthday photograph
item.description: The Queen, 94, donned the glittering Cullinan V brooch for the photo taken in the quadrangle of Windsor Castle to mark the Duke of Edinburgh's 99th birthday today.

item.title: London's Thames Clipper service to reopen next week
item.description: The service, which operates between Putney, in West London and goes as far east as Woolwich Arsenal, will resume operations on Monday morning - including a fully stocked bar.

item.title: Johnny Hallyday's first wife dismisses rumours she fell out with him over affair
item.description: Sylvie Vartan, first wife of singer Johnny Halliday, has denied rumours that she fell out with him over an alleged affair with actress Catherine Deneuve, saying she remembers it 'differently'.

item.title: SAGE scientist calls for South Korean-style Covid-19 hotels to stop Britons flouting self-isolation
item.description: Lucy Yardley, professor of health psychology at Bristol and Southampton universities, suggested putting suspected Covid-19 cases in dedicated hotels where they are far more likely to comply.

item.title: Prison dog handler, 58, wins nearly Â£100,000 compensation
item.description: A champion prison dog handler has won nearly Â£100,000 compensation because he was told he couldn't come back to work after his award-winning dog Chester had to be put down.Â

item.title: Scientists develop an eye scanner that can detect and track biological ageing in humans
item.description: There is no universally accepted measure of biological ageing, according to the Boston University School of Medicine team, who built the new scanner.

item.title: Primary school deputy head teacher, 30, is charged with possessing online child abuse images
item.description: Richard Swinnerton, 30, deputy head teacher at St Clare's Catholic Primary School in Middlesbrough, has been charged with possessing online images of child abuse and has resigned from his job.

item.title: UK faces biggest hit from coronavirus of any major economy in the WORLD
item.description: The OECD's latest estimates predict that GDP will nosedive by 11.5 per cent this year, even more than the 11.4 per cent expected in France and 11.3 per cent in Italy.

item.title: The sex positions that burn the most and least caloriesÂ
item.description: The best sex positions for burning calories have been revealed in eye-opening research, following the news that sex in households other than your own has been forbidden in the UK.Â

item.title: Apple could ditch Intel processors for its Macs
item.description: Apple is set to announce plans to ditch Intel processors for its Mac computers at its developers' conference later this month.

item.title: Widespread face mask use could shrink `RÂ´ and stop second wave
item.description: Modelling by the universities of Cambridge and Greenwich found if half of Brits wore face coverings in public it would prevent the crisis from spiralling back out of control.

item.title: NATO must focus on the threat posed by China, the military body's chief says
item.description: Mr Stoltenberg called for a 'more global approach' in response to China in a speech on Monday setting out his vision for the future of the organisation.

item.title: Try and spot the owl (it's a real hoot!)
item.description: At first glance, this photo looks the photographer might have missed the subject - but on closer inspection, you'll spot an owl hiding in plain sight.

item.title: Tiny bone discovered in the hearts of chimpanzees may be a sign of heart disease
item.description: Researchers from the UniversityÂ of Nottingham spotted the bone - which is mere millimetres in length - in micro-CT scans of chimp hearts.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak has worsened mental health, study says
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has worsened mental health unlike 'anything seen in recent years', especially for young women, a new study reports.

item.title: How has Covid-19 affected your hometown?
item.description: An interactive graphic created by researchers at the University of Cambridge shows how coronavirus deaths in each area of England and Wales break down by date and place of death.

item.title: Panicking passenger plunges into the water as they try to leap onto a departing ferry
item.description: The passenger is supposed to be travelling from his home in Paramushiro to Kamchatka, Russia. The man tries to fling a bag into the boat but ends up falling in the water.

item.title: Police hunt for family of four after couple vanish with two children
item.description: Charlene Collins, 25, and Martin Collins, 27, and their two children, aged approximately one and two, are missing from the O'Connor Court area of Derry, Northern Ireland.

item.title: Peers will be paid Â£162 to stay at home and vote on laws without coming to Parliament
item.description: While MPs have been forced to come back to the House of Commons to vote, the upper house has set up an online voting system to allow members to 'vote on a smartphone, laptop or other device.'

item.title: More than 500 jobs set to be lost after Monsoon Accessorize entered administration
item.description: British retailer Monsoon Accessorize expects to make 545 staff redundant as it closes 35 stores, and fashion chain Quiz is placing the division that runs its 82 standalone stores into administration.

item.title: Girl who was born with a rare skin condition, signs a contract with a top modelling agencyÂ Â
item.description: Angie, 43, and Kevin, 42, from Washington, whose daughter Harper Foy was diagnosed with Harlequin Ichthyosis, hope that having her sign up to a modelling agency will spread awareness.

item.title: Savvy women gives her tired-looking kitchen a modern makeover for Â£250
item.description: Lili Pat Dee, from Manchester, took to Facebook group Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK to reveal how she completely revamped her outdated kitchen for just Â£250.

item.title: Italian woman, 60, prepares stuffed olives while undergoing brain surgeryÂ
item.description: Her actions allowed the surgeons to calibrate their work as they operated onÂ the patient's left temporal lobe at the Azienda Ospedali Riuniti in Ancona.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton will 'take a leaf from Diana during AIDS epidemic' post-lockdown
item.description: Royal expert Nigel Cawthorne told FEMAIL he thinks the Cambridges will 'take a leaf from Prince William and Harry's mother during the AIDS epidemic' in their approach to returning to public duties.

item.title: Mother revealsÂ dodgy Â£180 fillers made her mouth 'fill with blisters' and lips EXPLODE five timesÂ
item.description: Gemma Palmer, 35, from Lancashire, paid Â£180 to have lip filler in 2018. The filler gathered on one side of her mouth and, despite having the filler dissolved, she has been left in agony ever since.

item.title: Kenneth Noye is seen driving again at exact spot where he killed Stephen Cameron
item.description: Notorious killer Kenneth Noyey, 72, was spotted at the M25 slip-road near Swanley in Kent where he stabbed Stephen Cameron, 21, to death in May 1996.

item.title: Mind blowing video showing how to remove oven glass door in seconds
item.description: An Australian homeowner has revealed how she made her greasy oven door squeaky clean after she discovered a little-known feature that removes the glass in seconds.

item.title: Three more Russian Covid-19 patients fall to deaths from hospital windows
item.description: The three further deaths come amid growing concerns among victims' family members that antibiotic drugs used to treat coronavirus patients are causing suicidal thoughts.

item.title: British woman, 89, is killed by gas explosion at her Costa del Sol apartment
item.description: Firefighters who scrambled to the scene discovered the woman's body crushed under rubble. Her husband was also injured in the blast early at the Torre del Mar apartment, east of Malaga.

item.title: McDonald's makes up the greatest proportionÂ of England's litter by brand
item.description: McDonald's packaging accounts for half of England's fast-food litter, while Coca-Cola makes up one in five discarded non-alcoholic drink containers, a new study reveals.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Property market bounces back with 137% sales surge
item.description: The average asking price of sales agreed over the past week was 6 per cent higher than the same week in June 2019 amid pent-up demand in Britain, according to Zoopla.

item.title: New powers to crack down on cycle lane misuse by motorists
item.description: Drivers will face fines of up to Â£130 after the Department of Transport announced tougher measures against misuse of cycle lanes in a new law that will be rolled out later this month.
item.media:description: Local authorities will be given new powers to crack down on misuse of cycle lanes (Chris Radburn/PA)

item.title: Mum shares VERY easy recipe for Malteser cake
item.description: Laura Middleton, from Kingston upon Hull, shared her recipe for a Malteser's cake on Facebook group Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK - and it has gone down a storm online.

item.title: Can you name the film that the iconic garden starred in?
item.description: The illustrations, created by British firm Hayes Garden World, show gardens, parks and landscapes that play a central role in major movie hits - but the characters have been removed.

item.title: Frankie and Benny's owner will permanently close 125 restaurants
item.description: The Restaurant Group, which owns Frankie and Benny's, has confirmed plans to close 125 of its sites as it tries to push down rents after the huge hit to the hospitality sector from coronavirus.

item.title: IBM ending facial recognition technology amid concern over mass surveillance and racial profiling
item.description: Arvind Krishna, the new CEO of IBM, wrote a letter to Democrat lawmakers on Monday, who are working to reform policing. Krishna said his company would no longer develop facial recognition.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Prince Andrew's legal woes
item.description: 'We're waiting for news on the pub reopening - they're here to interview Prince Andrew'

item.title: 10million patients could be stuck on NHS surgery waiting lists by Christmas due to coronavirus
item.description: The NHS predicts at least 10million people in England and Wales will be on waiting lists for routine surgery if there is a second wave of coronavirus this year.

item.title: Plastic surgeon sets up a DRIVE-THRU service for Botox injections in Florida
item.description: Dr.Â Michael Salzhauer set the quickie clinic up outside his Miami Beach office. Patients fill out paperwork online and drive up to a pull-in garage.

item.title: Hilarious video shows ice-cream-eating cat with 'brain freeze'
item.description: This is the hilarious moment a cat gets its first taste of ice cream and instantly regrets it. The video, posted by a Canadian TikTok user on June 3, shows the cat being fed the frozen treat.

item.title: Study does NOT recommend probiotics for Crohn's disease
item.description: New guidelines released by the American Gastroenterological Association identified only three clinical scenarios where probiotic use might benefit patients.

item.title: Mysterious repetitive radio bursts reported from deep space
item.description: Researchers from the University of Manchester studied long-term monitoring data from the Lovell Telescope at Jodrell Bank to understand these unusual signals.

item.title: Another big milestone for 7ft Freddy: World's tallest dog thought to be planet's oldest Great Dane
item.description: Owner Claire Stoneman, from Weeting, Norfolk, threw Freddy a big birthday party on May 17 - attended by the hound's best friend, Claire's seven-year-old neighbour Erin Manley (pictured).

item.title: Daniel Radcliffe responds to JK Rowling's transphobic Twitter rant: 'Transgender women are women'
item.description: Daniel Radcliffe, 30, who starred as the titular character in the Harry Potter franchise, has called out JK Rowling in a statement released via The Trevor Project on Monday.

item.title: Urgent recall: Apollo Bay Distiller brewer sells bottles of gin filled with HAND SANITISER
item.description: Apollo Bay Distiller is recalling 700ml bottles of SS Casion Dry Gin, which were sold at the Great Ocean Road Brewhouse in regional Victoria between 5pm on Friday and 7.30pm on Sunday.

item.title: JK Rowling hits back at claims she is 'transphobic'
item.description: Rowling drew outrage when she criticized a piece published by the website Devex, a media platform for the global development community, that used the phrase 'people who menstruate.'
item.media:description: FILE - In a Wednesday, Dec. 11, 2019 file photo, author and Lumos Foundation founder J.K. Rowling attends the HBO Documentary Films premiere of "Finding the Way Home" at 30 Hudson Yards, in New York. "Harry Potter" author J.K. Rowling has fallen under scrutiny after her series of tweets Saturday, June 6, 2020 were deemed as trans phobic.(Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP, File)
